00145 INT eb_begin_of_run(INT rn, char *UserField, char *error)
00146 {
00147 #if 0
00148   extern EBUILDER_SETTINGS ebset;
00149   extern EBUILDER_CHANNEL  ebch[MAX_CHANNELS];
00150   extern HNDLE hDB;
00151     
00152   int n;
00153   int mask = 0;
00154   
00155   char keyName[256]; 
00156   BOOL enabled;
00157   int size;
00158   
00159   /* 
00160    * Determine which crates are enabled and set up the mask 
00161    * accordingly.
00162    */
00163   for(n = 1; n <= NUMCRATES; n++) {
00164     sprintf(keyName, "/Equipment/Crate %d/Settings/Enabled", n);
00165     size = sizeof(enabled);
00166     db_get_value(hDB, 0, keyName, &enabled, &size, TID_BOOL, FALSE);
00167     if(size == sizeof(enabled) && enabled) {
00168        ebch[n-1].trigger_mask = (1 << (n-1));
00169        mask |= ebch[n-1].trigger_mask;
00170     } else {
00171        ebch[n-1].trigger_mask = 0;
00172     }
00173   }
00174 
00175   cm_msg(MINFO, "eb_begin_of_run", "Setting event mask to 0x%x", mask);
00176   ebset.trigger_mask = mask;
00177 #endif
00178 
00179   // Initialize online compression
00180   compress_load_all();
00181 
00182   return EB_SUCCESS;
00183 }

00259 INT eb_user(INT nfrag, BOOL mismatch, EBUILDER_CHANNEL * ebch
00260             , EVENT_HEADER * pheader, void *pevent, INT * dest_size)
00261 {
00262   if (mismatch){
00263     printf("Serial number do not match across fragments\n");
00264     for (int i = 0; i < nfrag; i++) {
00265       int serial = ((EVENT_HEADER *) ebch[i].pfragment)->serial_number;
00266       printf("Ser[%i]:%d ", i + 1, serial);
00267     }
00268     printf("\n");
00269     return EB_USER_ERROR;
00270   }
00271 
00272   // Initialize output event
00273   bk_init32(pevent);
00274 
00275   // Loop over the event fragments, performing compression into the output event
00276   for(int i = 0; i < nfrag; i++) {
00277     void *fragment =  ebch[i].pfragment;
00278 
00279     if(fragment != NULL) {
00280       compress_event(((EVENT_HEADER *) fragment) + 1, pevent);
00281       pheader->serial_number =
00282         ((EVENT_HEADER *) ebch[i].pfragment)->serial_number;
00283     }
00284   }
00285 
00286   // Set the size of the output event properly
00287   pheader->data_size = *dest_size = bk_size(pevent);
00288 
00289   // printf("Returning size %d\n", pheader->data_size);
00290 
00291   return EB_SUCCESS;
00292 
00293 }
